reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel whilst meeting friends in Nottingham. The stay did not start well with us not being able to find the hotel's reccomended car park. My partner called the hotel for directions but they were not very helpful and due to poor English they were unable to give us sufficient directions. We actually ended up in the Broadmarsh NCP which is about a 5min walk to the hotel and only costs £3 for 24 hours. This actually worked out better than the car park the hotel reccomended as theirs would have been £11 for 24 hours! Check in was quick and professional. Room on the 11th floor was roomy and fairly clean. Not up to usual Jury's Inn standards but it was ok. Slept very well and breakfast was delicious, apart from the raw bacon! In summary this hotel is pretty decent but dont expect perfection.
reviews.title: Good Jury's Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this Hotel with some airmiles I have had hanging around for the last twenty years. would not have picked this hotel had I known how far it was to be from the venue, but thats life. It is modern Building and crams a lot into a small space. I would not want to spend a long time here it was ok for one night. Location was quiet even if the guests were not, think stag/hen weekends nothing outrageous just young people having fun. Room was adequate but begining to look a bit tired, bed was awfull and had, had to much use, unable to open window due locking mechanism being broken. No parking apart from pay and display, but time this right over a weekend and you will not pay to much. Breakfast was good and plenty off it, staff were fine, Not sure on location as to night life etc but the cleintel were mainly young groups of men and women so I assume ok.
reviews.title: Reunion

reviews.text: Would I go back, only if someone else was paying
reviews.title: Suprisingly grand hotel in a good location at a reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For £55 I thought it was great. Decent clean room, very nice foyer, bar, lifts and decor. Staff were helpful. On a stag doo and it was a bit noisey late into the night. Not the romantic couples hotel but definately the perfect hotel for weekend group visits.
reviews.title: Good value for money, room not especially nice but functional

reviews.text: Room was air conditioned which we needed. No frills in room but had tea/coffee making facilities. Room was comfortable but not especially pretty or nice. Bathroom was clean but looked a little tired. The entrance foyer and downstairs lobby areas were attractive so we were disappointed with the interior of the room.
reviews.title: reasonable hotel with some issues

reviews.text: Tripadvisor rankings really puzzle me. At present, amongst Nottingham hotels, the Jury's Inn is ranked 10th with 3.5 blobs whereas the Lace Market, with 4 blobs is ranked 11th, and both are ranked below the Ibis.
reviews.title: Good business hotel, but not exceptional

reviews.text: The Jury's Inn and the Ibis are both large, good quality, corporate chain hotels whereas the Lace Market is an upmarket boutique hotel. All offer good value at their respective "rack rate" price points but there is no doubt that, without wishing to denigrate either the Ibis or the Jury's Inn, were the price the same or only slightly different, I would prefer to stay at the Lace Market any night! And I would prefer the Jury's Inn over the Ibis, too, but again this is reflected in their rack rates.
reviews.title: Stayed at this hotel for a football match...
Quite clean with a helpful staff, near rail station
reviews.text: It would be easy to damn any of the big corporate chain hotels with faint praise but really there really is little to criticise about this Jury's Inn. Staff were efficient and friendly, the room was decently sized, clean and appropriately equipped. Really, the fact that I have little to say indicates simply that it was very satisfactory.

The weakest point, I felt, was the breakfast - a self-service buffet, so hot food was left to congeal; the bacon and sausages of only mid-market quality; eggs without taste or texture; and indifferent coffee from a machine dispensing huge quantities presumably from extract. But this is no different to most other chain hotels and the breads, jams &c were fine.
reviews.title: Great hotel but out of the way from centre of Nottingham

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a football match at the city ground, perfect location for this about 15mins walk. Rooms good size and very clean the bed however rolled all over the place as the wheels weren't fixed! Drinks in the hotel bar were very expensive compared to the rest of the city.
reviews.title: Very Pleased
Lows outshine the averages!
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights for a training course. The room was clean and on first appearance on a par with nearby rivals. Unfortunately after a few usual checks i realised the bed, for a double was really small, with one finger i could push it across the room, and when getting into the bed you had to shuffle the bed back across toward the bedside table, Bill Bryson would of had a comedy field day with that one! The TV had limited channels and old fashioned, but when coming to have a bath, thats when i realised they have got something completely wrong. I am an average sized guy but with the bath as full as i usually fill it, when lying down the water barely covered half of my body. I realised the bath was so shallow and small that it's only use would be for a child or very small adult.

reviews.title: Totally redeemed itself
reviews.text: The food was average, breakfast was good. The bar prices were extortionate, £3 for half a cider, when the pint costs £4.50??? Thats bordering on the criminal!

reviews.title: Decent basic hotel
reviews.text: The parking is a real problem, and the usual rip off prices for parking your car in a large communal garage. A fair walk is also needed from the parking so beware if you have luggage. It was explained to me that i could drop off luggage prior to taking my car to garage but some of my colleagues were not made aware of this. £5 for an hour for WiFi in the room???..Thats terrible! Recently in Spain where all WiFi was free throughout hotel.

reviews.title: Great choice
reviews.text: The staff were friendly, but no 'did you have a nice stay' from reception.

reviews.title: Good value, pleasant stay - definitely recommend
reviews.text: Needless to say i won't use this hotel again, certainly not for my family, and because of parking problems and price to qulaity not for business either.

We arrived sooner than planned but were allowed to check into our room early. Room was clean, basic though fairly modern. Bedding was crisp. Bathroom of a fair size and again clean. A minor complaint and this happens in many hotels was that the buffet breakfast wasn't hot, it had cooled considerably but was still edible. The room was quiet despite being near the railway and a busy road. The hotel is five minutes from the train station and the NCP multi storey car park we used, across the road from the station was £3 for 24 hrs. I did expect the Jurys Inn room to be a lot better than a Premier Inn room and I would say it was only a bit better. I would obviously stay there again and would also recommend this hotel to a friend.
reviews.title: Good Clean Well Situated Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After having a bad experiece with staff while staying here once before we decided that may have been a one off. However some staff were very unhelpful and blatently lied to my face. After makng a payment over the phone, at check out they claimed no payment had been taken and their policy didnt involve taking card details over the phone when the person who i had dealt with was there she tried to deny even being on reception. They all stick up for one another and would never admit their wrong, leaving the start to my brithday with a negative feeling. I wouldnt stay here again and i wouldnt recommend it to anyone, the bathroom smelt like sewage badly, the shower didnt work properly and there were hairs and dirt in the bath. Not really what to expect for the price you pay and their star rating. Etap everytime from now on their service is way better and they have much better trained staff.
reviews.title: Unprofessional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although I actually live in a suburb just outside Nottingham, I often stay here after a night out to save me on taxi fare and for their great breakfasts!
reviews.title: Stayed here numerous times - Fab!

reviews.text: Every time I have stayed here, I have been met with the professionalism and service you would expect from a 5-star hotel. The rooms are always spotless, and the location is fantastic - especially for my preferred watering holes down at the Waterfront, Lace Market and round the Castle.
reviews.title: good location friendly staff

reviews.text: As it is not (in some people's opinions) smack bang in the middle of town, it is very quiet, which proves for a relaxing night's sleep. I have stayed at the Lace Market Hotel on a Saturday night for 5 times the price I pay for the Jurys, and the noise from the street was so terrible I couldn't sleep. However, I never have this problem at the Jurys, and you can never hear the road traffic either.
reviews.title: Excellent
